## CloudDurableTestRunner.run() method

Runs the durable function and returns the test result.

This method invokes the Lambda function, polls for execution history, and returns a comprehensive test result containing the function output and all operation details.

**Signature:**

```typescript
run(params?: InvokeRequest): Promise<TestResult<TResult>>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter

</th><th>

Type

</th><th>

Description

</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

params

</td><td>

[InvokeRequest](./durable-execution-sdk-js-testing.invokerequest.md)

</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Optional parameters for the function invocation

</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

Promise&lt;[TestResult](./durable-execution-sdk-js-testing.testresult.md)<!-- -->&lt;TResult&gt;&gt;

A promise that resolves to the test result containing function output and operation history

## Exceptions

Will throw an error if no execution ARN is returned from the Lambda invocation which can occur if the function is not a durable function.

## Example

```typescript
const result = await runner.run({
  payload: { userId: "123", action: "process" },
});
console.log("Function result:", result.getResult());
console.log("Operations count:", result.getOperations().length);
```
